thread.title: Edward Snowden: Waiting on DOJ on plea deal
thread.title_full: Edward Snowden: Waiting on DOJ on plea deal - POLITICO

author: Nick Gass
title: Edward Snowden: Waiting on DOJ on plea deal
text:
Edward Snowden is still waiting on the Justice Department to take up his offer of a plea deal, the former National Security Agency contractor who leaked thousands of classified documents says. "We are still waiting for them to call us back," Snowden said in an interview on the BBC's "Panorama" program airing Monday, according to a report from The Guardian . The 32-year-old remains in Russia, where he has two more years of asylum after the country decided to extend his original asylum last August.
Michael Hayden, the former head of the NSA, told the BBC, according to the Guardian's report, that Snowden "is going to die in Moscow. He's not coming home."
Snowden, who started tweeting under his eponymous handle last week , said he was prepared to go to prison.
Deal reached on giant 12-nation trade pact By Doug Palmer
The latest interview comes months after former Attorney General Eric Holder told Yahoo's Michael Isikoff that a "possibility exists" for Snowden to make a deal with the U.S. government so that he can return from Moscow.
In July 2014 . Holder said that should Snowden return to the U.S. and enter a guilty plea, "we would engage with his lawyers." If Snowden did return, he would face charges under the Espionage Act of 1917.
In March, one of Snowden's attorneys told POLITICO that her client "would be amenable to coming back to the United States for the kind of plea bargain that Gen. [David] Petraeus received."
